```{r }

slices=c(20.9, 30.6, 24.7,15.7,8.1)
Age= c("Under 20", "20-24", "25-29","30-34","35 and over")
pct=round(slices/sum(slices)*100,digits = 1)
Age=paste("Aged",Age)
Age=paste(Age,pct, sep=" : ")
Age=paste(Age,"%")
pie(slices,labels= Age)
barplot(slices, names.arg=c("Under 20", "20-24", "25-29", "30-34", "35 and over"),xlab=" the age which had a first child" )

# 
```

##### 我認為在這個例子中使用barchart較好，因為Ｘ軸代表的資料是具有連續性的年紀，barchart可以顯示出來連續的趨勢，也就是以24-29歲為高峰，接著逐漸往下。但是pirchart就較難看出這種趨勢。
